alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 2:22AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN WEBER...SOUTHEASTERN CACHE...SOUTHERN RICH...EAST CENTRAL DAVIS...MORGAN AND NORTHWESTERN SUMMIT COUNTIES... At 221 AM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 6 miles east of Mantua to near Centerville...and moving east at 40 mph. Locations impacted include... Morgan, Coalville, East Canyon State Park, Henefer, Huntsville, Nordic Valley, Mountain Green, Portersville, Echo, Powder Mountain, Stoddard, Peterson, Richville, Echo Reservoir, Wahsatch, Emory, Causey Reservoir, Croydon, Castle Rock and Pineview Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 84 between mile markers 93 and 119. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 163 and 196. * winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this squall. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
